content.description:
At vero Aeneas aspectu obmutuit amens,

arrectaeque horrore comae et vox faucibus haesit.

Ardet abire fuga dulcesque relinquere terras,

attonitus tanto monitu imperioque deorum.

(5)Â Heu quid agat? Quo nunc reginam ambire furentem

audeat adfatu? Quae prima exordia sumat?

Aeneid 4.279-284

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words.
content.question: Translate fuga (line 3) and identify the case.

frqParts.text: Translate fuga (line 3) and identify the case.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
